cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast toward Florida’s Big Bend, then accelerating NE across Georgia/South Carolina and moving off the North Carolina coast toward the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Suwannee River–Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Marineland, FL to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Suwannee River–Mexico Beach, FL; Hurricane Watch Anclote River–Suwannee River and Mexico Beach–Destin; Tropical Storm Warning Anclote River–Suwannee River and Mexico Beach–Destin
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast, Georgia coast, South and North Carolina coast, Mid-Atlantic coast to New England
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (peak 35–45 kt, gusts 50+ kt) Saturday as the center passes just inland/east of Wilmington
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches according to NHC surge statement (Florida-Georgia line to Cape Fear 1–3 ft)
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 10-inch totals possible across eastern North Carolina, including Wilmington, causing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk and short-fuse waterspout threat in outer rainbands; dangerous rip currents and heavy surf likely
